mlp

Class MlpUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • mlp.MlpUtility

  • public class MlpUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a utility class that provides several static methods used in the mlp package.

    • Method Detail

      • csv2Map

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> csv2Map(java.util.List<java.lang.String> lines)
        Converts a List of comma-separated key-value pairs, one pair per line, into a map with the corresponding keys and values. It ignores any Java-style comments.
        Parameters:
        lines - a List of text lines, where every line is either a comment with possibly leading spaces, or a comma-separated pair of strings, with possibly leading and/or trailing spaces, and possibly trailing end-of-line comments. Any line that is not of the latter type is ignored.
        Returns:
        a map where for each comma-separated pair, a key-value pair entry is in the map, where the key is the first string, and the value is the second string. Leading and/or trailing spaces and comments are all stripped away.

      • stripCommentsFromLines

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> stripCommentsFromLines(java.util.List<java.lang.String> lines)
        Removes Java-style comments, returning the remaining non-empty lines.
        Parameters:
        lines - a List of text lines, where every line is either a comment with possibly leading spaces, or a non-comment string with possibly leading and/or trailing spaces, and possibly trailing end-of-line comments. Any line that is not of the latter type is ignored.
        Returns:
        a list of non-empty lines stripped from any comments

      • isComment

        public static boolean isComment(java.lang.String str)
        Indicates if the specied input is a Java-style comment, i.e., starts with // possibly preceded by leading spaces.
        Parameters:
        str - a String that represents a line of text
        Returns:
        true if the input line, trimmed of any leading spaces, is a comment (i.e., starts with //).

      • isComment

        public static boolean isComment(java.lang.String line,
                                boolean runningMultilineComment)
        Indicates if the specified input line is Java-style comment or is inside a multi-line comment.
        Parameters:
        line - a String that represents a line of text
        runningMultilineComment - a Boolean indicator that is true if the specified input line is inside a multi-line comment
        Returns:
        true if the input line, trimmed of any leading spaces, is a comment (i.e., starts with //) or inside a comment. Otherwise, it returns false.

      • startsComment

        public static boolean startsComment(java.lang.String line)
        indicates if the specified input line starts a comment (signaled by "/*") that extends beyond the specified input line.
        Parameters:
        line - a String that represents a line of text
        Returns:
        true if the specified input line starts a comment (signaled by "/*") that extends beyond the specified input line. The method makes no assumption about whether or not the specified line is in the context of a running multi-line comment.

      • startsComment

        public static boolean startsComment(java.lang.String line,
                                    boolean runningMultilineComment)
        indiactes if the specified input line starts a comment (signaled by "/*") that extends beyond the specified input line.
        Parameters:
        line - a String that represents a line of text
        runningMultilineComment - an indicator whether the specified input line comes as part of a running multi-line comment, fully or partially. If this parameter's value is true, then it is assumed that the characters (including "//") in the specified line that occurs before an asterisk followed by a forward slash are part of the multi-line comment. If the parameter's value is false, this method treats any unmatched asterisk slash as regular text not part of a comment.
        Returns:
        true if the specified input line starts a comment (signaled by "/*") that extends beyond the specified input line.

      • endsComment

        public static boolean endsComment(java.lang.String line)
        Indicates whether the specified input line ends a multi-line comment that is assumed to have started at an earlier line.
        Parameters:
        line - a String that represents a line of text
        Returns:
        true if the specified input line ends a multi-line comment that is assumed to have started at an earlier line. It is the responsibility of the use to ensure that indeed there was a comment started at an earlier line.

      • stripComment

        public static java.lang.String stripComment(java.lang.String line)
        Deletes any embedded inline comments (which start with /* and end in the same line), any portion of a multi-line comment that starts or ends in the specified line, and any end-of-line comment signaled by "//". If an asterisk slash is encountered before a "//" and before an unmatched "/*", a multiline running comment is then assumed, and the prefix up to and including this asterisk slash are stripped away.
        Parameters:
        line - an input line, i.e., a String
        Returns:
        the line after being stripped from its comment(s) and any portions of multi-line comments; otherwise, it returns the specified input line unchanged.

      • stripComment

        public static java.lang.String stripComment(java.lang.String line,
                                            boolean runningMultilineComment)
        Deletes any embedded inline comments (which start with /* and end in he same line), any portion of a multi-line comment that starts or ends in the specified line, and any end-of-line comment signaled by "//"..
        Parameters:
        line - an input line, i.e., a String
        runningMultilineComment - an indicator whether the specified input line comes as part of a running multi-line comment, fully or partially. If this parameter's value is true, then it is assumed that the characters (including "//") in the specified line that occurs before an asterisk followed by a forward slash are part of the multi-line comment and will be stripped away. If the parameter's value is false, this method treats any unmatched asterisk slash as regular text not part of a comment.
        Returns:
        the line after being stripped from its comment(s) and any portions of multi-line comments; otherwise, it returns the specified input line unchanged.

      • collectionToString

        public static java.lang.String collectionToString(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> col,
                                                  java.lang.String separator)
        Concatenates the String elements of the specified input collection, separating them with the specified separator.
        Parameters:
        col - the input collection of Strings to be concatenated
        separator - the separator separating between the collection's Strings in the final result
        Returns:
        the resulting concatenated string.

      • fileToLines

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> fileToLines(java.lang.String infile)
        Reads the specified file and returns a list of its lines, one String element per line.
        Parameters:
        infile - the full name of a file to be read
        Returns:
        a List of lines, namely, the lines of the specified input file. If an IOException is raised, the method returns an empty list.

      • fileToLines

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> fileToLines(java.nio.file.Path infile)
        Reads the specified file and returns a list of its lines, one String element per line.
        Parameters:
        infile - the Path of a file to be read
        Returns:
        a List of lines, namely, the lines of the specified input file. If an IOException is raised, the method returns an empty list.

      • fileToLines

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> fileToLines(java.io.File infile)
        Reads the specified file and returns a list of its lines, one String element per line.
        Parameters:
        infile - the File of a file to be read
        Returns:
        a List of lines, namely, the lines of the specified input file. If an IOException is raised, the method returns an empty list.

      • linesToFile

        public static boolean linesToFile(java.lang.Iterable<? extends java.lang.CharSequence> lines,
                                  java.lang.String outfile)
        Writes the specified lines into the specified file.
        Parameters:
        lines - the list of lines to be printed to the specified file
        outfile - the file to which the specified list of lines is to be printed
        Returns:
        true if the input lines were successfully written to the specified file. Otherwise, as when an Exception was raised, it returns false.

      • mapToFile

        public static boolean mapToFile(java.util.Map<? extends java.lang.CharSequence,? extends java.lang.CharSequence> map,
                                java.lang.String outfile,
                                java.lang.String key_value_Sep)
        Writes out the specified map, one entry per line, separating the key from the value by the specified key_value_Sep, so each line is in the form of:
        key key_value_Sep value
        Parameters:
        map - the map to be written out
        outfile - the file where the map will be written
        key_value_Sep - the String that separates the key from the value. Typical values for this parameter include ":", ",", "-", etc.
        Returns:
        true if the input map was successfully written to the specified file. Otherwise, as when an Exception was raised, it returns false.

      • print

        public static void print(java.lang.String s)
        prints the specified input string
        Parameters:
        s - the string to be printed

      • print

        public static void print(char c)
        prints the specified input character
        Parameters:
        c - the character to be printed
